text:
Mr. Joseph Golden
October 24, 1956
In addition, Active members with radio stations may use the facilities of the
NAEB Radio Network upon payment of an annual :etwork fee. The Network distributes
approximately eight hours of programming, by tape recording, weekly, to members
subscribing to its service. This fee is also based on power (with the same power
classifications as membership) and a new station does not have to pay the full fee
until the third year it is in the Network. The fees are*
3BL3BfiE
$800.00
Class A
Class B
Class C
500.00
300.00
375.00
225.00
250.00
150.00
Stations must also pay postage both ways on the tapes shipped to and from Network
Headquarters here in Urbana, Illinois. Still even a Class A station paying its
full third-year rate is paying only a little over $2.00 an hour for better than
/tpn hours of programming from the Network in a year. This is about the most
inexpensive programming a station can do.
If, after looking over the materials which we shall send you, you have further
questions, we shall be most happy to answer them.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
